greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A070939(n) mod A000120(n), where A070939(n) is the binary length of n and A000120(n) is the binary weight of n.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[Mod[IntegerLength[n, 2], Total@ IntegerDigits[n, 2]], {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 21 2015 *)
program: for n in range(1, 88): print str((len(bin(n))-2) % bin(n).count('1'))+',',
results.author: _Alex Ratushnyak_, Dec 18 2015
